Class WayPoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • SimulationFramework.Marker
      • WayPoint
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SimulationFramework.Drawable

    public class WayPoint
extends SimulationFramework.Marker

    A WayPoint inherits from Marker in order to color it and set it a size.
    ::::NOTE:::: Some fields are from Project 2 and were used for debugging purposes. Database is used instead.

    Since:
    12/13/2015
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Armen Arslanian, Anderson Giang

    • Constructor Detail

      • WayPoint

        public WayPoint(int x,
                int y,
                int height,
                int cityCost,
                int gold,
                int mapX,
                int mapY,
                int countOfNeighbors,
                ArrayList<Point> neighbors)

        Constructor that creates a WayPoint.

        By default, the WayPoints are black and have a size of 2. City, gold, and map WayPoints have a size of 5. City WayPoints are cyan. Gold Waypoints are yellow. Map WayPoints are magenta.

        Parameters:
        x - WayPoint x coordinate
        y - WayPoint y coordinate
        height - WayPoint location height (elevation)
        cityCost - If WayPoint has city cost
        gold - If WayPoint has gold
        mapX - If WayPoint has mapX coordinate
        mapY - If WayPoint has mapY coordinate
        countOfNeighbors - How many neighbors does the WayPoint have
        neighbors - WayPoint's neighbor coordinates

    • Method Detail

      • isVisited

        public boolean isVisited()

        True means the point is visited. False means the point is not visited.

        Returns:
        Visited boolean value.

      • setVisited

        public void setVisited(boolean visited)

        Set Method to set visited point to true. True means the point is visited. False means the point is not visited.

        Parameters:
        visited - boolean variable.
